comments: Multiplied by -1, this is zeta(-5), where zeta is the Riemann zeta function. - Alonso del Arte, Jan 13 2012A closely matching sequence:  -253968.253968253968 . . . may be derived by the formula stated below which is from Hardy and Wright, An Introduction to the Theory of Numbers, Sixth Ed., p.53 in a proof of the irrationality of e. - _Douglas L. Fox_, Apr 30 2012
formula: a(n)=(1/30)*{41*(n mod 6)+[(n+1) mod 6]+26*[(n+2) mod 6]-19*[(n+3) mod 6]+21*[(n+4) mod 6]-4*[(n+5) mod 6]}-2*[C(2*n,n) mod 2]-5*{C[(n+1)^2,n+3] mod 2}, with n>=0 [From _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 05 2009](X^n * (1-X)^n)/n! where X=5, n=7 (see comment above). - _Douglas L. Fox_, Apr 30 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
